intro: Syzygium retinervium, commonly known as the white-flowered tamarind. It is a small evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia, characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, containing a single seed. Syzygium retinervium is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and floral display. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil.
